description: Cox's Bazar is a seaside town known for its long sandy beach and historical significance. It is the longest natural sea beach in the world and a popular destination for tourists from all over the world.
Sreemangal is a hilly area known for its tea plantations, forests, and wildlife. It is also known as the tea capital of Bangladesh and attracts tourists with its scenic beauty and serene environment.

The Sundarbans is a mangrove forest and delta located in the southern part of Bangladesh. It is the largest mangrove forest in the world and home to a variety of wildlife, including the Bengal tiger. It is a popular destination for nature lovers and eco-tourists.
